title: Account for pH of 6.8 for pure water at 37 C

content.question: Which of the following accounts for the observation that the pH of pure water at 37°C is 6.8?

choices.label: At 37°C the autoionization constant for water, Kw, is larger than it is at 25°C.
At 37°C water has a lower density than it does at 25°C; therefore, [H+] is greater.
At 37°C water ionizes to a lesser extent than it does at 25°C

content.answer: At 37°C the autoionization constant for water, Kw, is larger than it is at 25°C.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
